00061 // give pSoldier usNumChances to improve ubStat.  If it's from training, it doesn't count towards experience level gain
00062 void StatChange(SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier, UINT8 ubStat, UINT16 usNumChances, UINT8 ubReason)
00063 {
00064       // WANNE 2
00065       if (pSoldier == NULL || pSoldier->bActive == FALSE)
00066             return;     // THIS SHOULD NEVER HAPPEN
00067       
00068       Assert(pSoldier != NULL);
00069       Assert(pSoldier->bActive);
00070 
00071       // ignore non-player soldiers
00072       if (!PTR_OURTEAM)
00073             return;
00074 
00075       // ignore anything without a profile
00076       if (pSoldier->ubProfile == NO_PROFILE)
00077             return;
00078 
00079       // ignore vehicles and robots
00080       if( ( pSoldier->uiStatusFlags & SOLDIER_VEHICLE ) || ( pSoldier->uiStatusFlags & SOLDIER_ROBOT ) )
00081             return;
00082 
00083       if( pSoldier->bAssignment == ASSIGNMENT_POW )
00084       {
00085             ScreenMsg( FONT_ORANGE, MSG_BETAVERSION, L"ERROR: StatChange: %s improving stats while POW! ubStat %d", pSoldier->name, ubStat );
00086             return;
00087       }
00088 
00089       // no points earned while somebody is unconscious (for assist XPs, and such)
00090       if ( pSoldier->bLife < CONSCIOUSNESS )
00091             return;
00092 
00093 
00094 #ifdef TESTVERSION
00095       if ( gTacticalStatus.fStatChangeCheatOn )
00096       {
00097             usNumChances = 100;
00098       }
00099 #endif
00100 
00101       ProcessStatChange( &( gMercProfiles[ pSoldier->ubProfile ] ), ubStat, usNumChances, ubReason );
00102 
00103       // Update stats....right away... ATE
00104       UpdateStats( pSoldier );
00105 }

00109 // give pProfile usNumChances to improve ubStat.  If it's from training, it doesn't count towards experience level gain
00110 void ProfileStatChange(MERCPROFILESTRUCT *pProfile, UINT8 ubStat, UINT16 usNumChances, UINT8 ubReason)
00111 {
00112       // dead guys don't do nuthin' !
00113       if ( pProfile->bMercStatus == MERC_IS_DEAD )
00114             return;
00115 
00116       if ( pProfile->bLife < OKLIFE )
00117             return;
00118 
00119       ProcessStatChange( pProfile, ubStat, usNumChances, ubReason );
00120 
00121       // Update stats....right away... ATE
00122       ProfileUpdateStats( pProfile );
00123 }

00126 void ProcessStatChange(MERCPROFILESTRUCT *pProfile, UINT8 ubStat, UINT16 usNumChances, UINT8 ubReason)
00127 {
00128   UINT32 uiCnt,uiEffLevel;
00129   INT16 sSubPointChange = 0;
00130       UINT16 usChance=0;
00131       UINT16 usSubpointsPerPoint;
00132       UINT16 usSubpointsPerLevel;
00133       INT8 bCurrentRating;
00134   UINT16 *psStatGainPtr;
00135       BOOLEAN fAffectedByWisdom = TRUE;
00136 
00137       Assert(pProfile != NULL);
00138 
00139   if ( pProfile->bEvolution == NO_EVOLUTION )
00140     return;     // No change possible, quit right away
00141 
00142   // if this is a Reverse-Evolving merc who attempting to train
00143   if ( ( ubReason == FROM_TRAINING ) && ( pProfile->bEvolution == DEVOLVE ) )
00144     return; // he doesn't get any benefit, but isn't penalized either
00145 
00146       if (usNumChances == 0)
00147             return;
00148 
00149 
00150       usSubpointsPerPoint = SubpointsPerPoint(ubStat, pProfile->bExpLevel);
00151       usSubpointsPerLevel = SubpointsPerPoint(EXPERAMT, pProfile->bExpLevel);
00152 
00153   switch (ubStat)
00154   {
00155     case HEALTHAMT:
00156       bCurrentRating = pProfile->bLifeMax;
00157       psStatGainPtr = (UINT16 *)&(pProfile->sLifeGain);
00158                   // NB physical stat checks not affected by wisdom, unless training is going on
00159                   fAffectedByWisdom = FALSE;
00160       break;
00161 
00162     case AGILAMT:
00163       bCurrentRating = pProfile->bAgility;
00164       psStatGainPtr = (UINT16 *)&(pProfile->sAgilityGain);
00165                   fAffectedByWisdom = FALSE;
00166       break;
00167 
00168     case DEXTAMT:
00169       bCurrentRating = pProfile->bDexterity;
00170       psStatGainPtr = (UINT16 *)&(pProfile->sDexterityGain);
00171                   fAffectedByWisdom = FALSE;
00172       break;
00173 
00174     case WISDOMAMT:
00175       bCurrentRating = pProfile->bWisdom;
00176       psStatGainPtr = (UINT16 *)&(pProfile->sWisdomGain);
00177       break;
00178 
00179     case MEDICALAMT:
00180       bCurrentRating = pProfile->bMedical;
00181       psStatGainPtr = (UINT16 *)&(pProfile->sMedicalGain);
00182       break;
00183 
00184     case EXPLODEAMT:
00185       bCurrentRating = pProfile->bExplosive;
00186       psStatGainPtr = (UINT16 *)&(pProfile->sExplosivesGain);
00187       break;
00188 
00189     case MECHANAMT:
00190       bCurrentRating = pProfile->bMechanical;
00191       psStatGainPtr = (UINT16 *)&(pProfile->sMechanicGain);
00192       break;
00193 
00194     case MARKAMT:
00195       bCurrentRating = pProfile->bMarksmanship;
00196       psStatGainPtr = (UINT16 *)&(pProfile->sMarksmanshipGain);
00197       break;
00198 
00199     case EXPERAMT:
00200       bCurrentRating = pProfile->bExpLevel;
00201       psStatGainPtr = (UINT16 *)&(pProfile->sExpLevelGain);
00202       break;
00203 
00204             case STRAMT:
00205       bCurrentRating = pProfile->bStrength;
00206       psStatGainPtr = (UINT16 *)&(pProfile->sStrengthGain);
00207                   fAffectedByWisdom = FALSE;
00208       break;
00209 
00210             case LDRAMT:
00211       bCurrentRating = pProfile->bLeadership;
00212       psStatGainPtr = (UINT16 *)&(pProfile->sLeadershipGain);
00213       break;
00214 
00215     default:
00216                   // BETA message
00217       ScreenMsg( FONT_ORANGE, MSG_BETAVERSION, L"ERROR: ProcessStatChange: Rcvd unknown ubStat %d", ubStat);
00218       return;
00219   }
00220 
00221 
00222       if (ubReason == FROM_TRAINING)
00223       {
00224             // training always affected by wisdom
00225             fAffectedByWisdom = TRUE;
00226       }
00227 
00228 
00229       // stats/skills of 0 can NEVER be improved!
00230       if ( bCurrentRating < 0 )
00231       {
00232             return;
00233       }
00234 
00235 
00236   // loop once for each chance to improve
00237   for (uiCnt = 0; uiCnt < usNumChances; uiCnt++)
00238   {
00239     if (pProfile->bEvolution == NORMAL_EVOLUTION)               // Evolves!
00240     {
00241                   // if this is improving from a failure, and a successful roll would give us enough to go up a point
00242                   if ((ubReason == FROM_FAILURE) && ((*psStatGainPtr + 1) >= usSubpointsPerPoint))
00243                   {
00244                         // can't improve any more from this statchange, because Ian don't want failures causin increases!
00245                         break;
00246                   }
00247 
00248       if (ubStat != EXPERAMT)
00249                   {
00250                         // NON-experience level changes, actual usChance depends on bCurrentRating
00251                         // Base usChance is '100 - bCurrentRating'
00252                         usChance = 100 - (bCurrentRating + (*psStatGainPtr / usSubpointsPerPoint));
00253 
00254                         // prevent training beyond the training cap
00255                         if ((ubReason == FROM_TRAINING) && (bCurrentRating + (*psStatGainPtr / usSubpointsPerPoint) >= gGameExternalOptions.ubTrainingSkillMax))
00256                         {
00257                               usChance = 0;
00258                         }
00259                   }
00260       else
00261       {
00262                     // Experience level changes, actual usChance depends on level
00263                     // Base usChance is '100 - (10 * current level)'
00264                         usChance = 100 - 10 * (bCurrentRating + (*psStatGainPtr / usSubpointsPerPoint));
00265       }
00266 
00267       // if there IS a usChance, adjust it for high or low wisdom (50 is avg)
00268       if (usChance > 0 && fAffectedByWisdom)
00269                   {
00270                         usChance += (usChance * (pProfile->bWisdom + (pProfile->sWisdomGain / SubpointsPerPoint(WISDOMAMT, pProfile->bExpLevel)) - 50)) / 100;
00271                   }
00272 
00273 /*
00274       // if the stat is Marksmanship, and the guy is a hopeless shot
00275       if ((ubStat == MARKAMT) && (pProfile->bSpecialTrait == HOPELESS_SHOT))
00276                   {
00277                         usChance /= 5;          // MUCH slower to improve, divide usChance by 5
00278                   }
00279 */
00280 
00281       // maximum possible usChance is 99%
00282       if (usChance > 99)
00283                   {
00284                         usChance = 99;
00285                   }
00286 
00287             if (PreRandom(100) < usChance )
00288       {
00289         (*psStatGainPtr)++;
00290                         sSubPointChange++;
00291 
00292         // as long as we're not dealing with exp_level changes (already added above!)
00293         // and it's not from training, and the exp level isn't max'ed out already
00294         if ((ubStat != EXPERAMT) && (ubReason != FROM_TRAINING))
00295         {
00296           uiEffLevel = pProfile->bExpLevel + (pProfile->sExpLevelGain / usSubpointsPerLevel);
00297 
00298                               // if level is not at maximum
00299               if (uiEffLevel < MAXEXPLEVEL)
00300                               {
00301                                     // if this is NOT improving from a failure, OR it would NOT give us enough to go up a level
00302                                     if ((ubReason != FROM_FAILURE) || ((pProfile->sExpLevelGain + 1) < usSubpointsPerLevel))
00303                                     {
00304                                           // all other stat changes count towards experience level changes (1 for 1 basis)
00305                                           pProfile->sExpLevelGain++;
00306                                     }
00307                               }
00308                         }
00309           }
00310     }
00311     else                          // Regresses!
00312     {
00313                   // regression can happen from both failures and successes (but not training, checked above)
00314 
00315       if (ubStat != EXPERAMT)
00316       {
00317                         // NON-experience level changes, actual usChance depends on bCurrentRating
00318                         switch (ubStat)
00319                         {
00320                               case HEALTHAMT:
00321                               case AGILAMT:
00322                               case DEXTAMT:
00323                               case WISDOMAMT:
00324                               case STRAMT:
00325                                     // Base usChance is 'bCurrentRating - 1', since these must remain at 1-100
00326                                     usChance = bCurrentRating + (*psStatGainPtr / usSubpointsPerPoint) - 1;
00327                                     break;
00328 
00329                               case MEDICALAMT:
00330                               case EXPLODEAMT:
00331                               case MECHANAMT:
00332                               case MARKAMT:
00333                               case LDRAMT:
00334                                     // Base usChance is 'bCurrentRating', these can drop to 0
00335                                     usChance = bCurrentRating + (*psStatGainPtr / usSubpointsPerPoint);
00336                                     break;
00337                         }
00338       }
00339       else
00340                   {
00341                         // Experience level changes, actual usChance depends on level
00342                         // Base usChance is '10 * (current level - 1)'
00343                         usChance = 10 * (bCurrentRating + (*psStatGainPtr / usSubpointsPerPoint) - 1);
00344 
00345                         // if there IS a usChance, adjust it for high or low wisdom (50 is avg)
00346                         if (usChance > 0 && fAffectedByWisdom)
00347                         {
00348                               usChance -= (usChance * (pProfile->bWisdom + (pProfile->sWisdomGain / SubpointsPerPoint(WISDOMAMT, pProfile->bExpLevel)) - 50)) / 100;
00349                         }
00350 
00351                         // if there's ANY usChance, minimum usChance is 1% regardless of wisdom
00352                         if (usChance < 1)
00353                         {
00354                               usChance = 1;
00355                         }
00356       }
00357 
00358       if (PreRandom(100) < usChance )
00359       {
00360                         (*psStatGainPtr)--;
00361                         sSubPointChange--;
00362 
00363         // as long as we're not dealing with exp_level changes (already added above!)
00364         // and it's not from training, and the exp level isn't max'ed out already
00365         if ((ubStat != EXPERAMT) && (ubReason != FROM_TRAINING))
00366         {
00367           uiEffLevel = pProfile->bExpLevel + (pProfile->sExpLevelGain / usSubpointsPerLevel );
00368 
00369                               // if level is not at minimum
00370           if (uiEffLevel > 1)
00371                               {
00372             // all other stat changes count towards experience level changes (1 for 1 basis)
00373             pProfile->sExpLevelGain--;
00374                               }
00375                         }                 
00376       }
00377     }
00378   }
00379 
00380 #ifdef STAT_CHANGE_DEBUG
00381       if (sSubPointChange != 0)
00382       {
00383             // debug message
00384             ScreenMsg( MSG_FONT_RED, MSG_DEBUG, L"%s's %s changed by %d", pProfile->zNickname, wDebugStatStrings[ubStat], sSubPointChange );
00385       }
00386 #endif
00387 
00388 
00389       // exclude training, that's not under our control
00390       if (ubReason != FROM_TRAINING)
00391       {
00392             // increment counters that track how often stat changes are being awarded
00393             pProfile->usStatChangeChances[ ubStat ] += usNumChances;
00394             pProfile->usStatChangeSuccesses[ ubStat ] += abs( sSubPointChange );
00395       }
00396 }

00624                         // tell player about it
00625                         BuildStatChangeString( wTempString, pSoldier->name, fChangeTypeIncrease, sPtsChanged, ubStat );
00626                         ScreenMsg( FONT_MCOLOR_LTYELLOW, MSG_INTERFACE, wTempString );
00627                   }
00628 
00629                   // update mapscreen soldier info panel
00630                   fCharacterInfoPanelDirty = TRUE;
00631 
00632                   // remember what time it changed at, it's displayed in a different color for a while afterwards
00633                   *puiStatTimerPtr = GetJA2Clock();
00634 
00635                   if( fChangeTypeIncrease )
00636                   {
00637                         pSoldier->usValueGoneUp |= usIncreaseValue;
00638                   }
00639                   else
00640                   {
00641                         pSoldier->usValueGoneUp &= ~( usIncreaseValue );
00642                   }
00643 
00644                   fInterfacePanelDirty = DIRTYLEVEL2;
00645             }
00646 
00647 
00648             // special handling for LIFEMAX
00649             if( ubStat == HEALTHAMT )
00650             {
00651                   // adjust current health by the same amount as max health
00652                   pProfile->bLife += sPtsChanged;
00653 
00654                   // don't let this kill a guy or knock him out!!!
00655                   if (pProfile->bLife < OKLIFE)
00656                   {
00657                         pProfile->bLife = OKLIFE;
00658                   }
00659 
00660                   // if the guy is employed by player
00661                   if (pSoldier != NULL)
00662                   {
00663                         // adjust current health by the same amount as max health
00664                         pSoldier->bLife += sPtsChanged;
00665 
00666                         // don't let this kill a guy or knock him out!!!
00667                         if (pSoldier->bLife < OKLIFE)
00668                         {
00669                               pSoldier->bLife = OKLIFE;
00670                         }
00671                   }
00672             }
00673 
00674             // special handling for EXPERIENCE LEVEL
00675             // merc salaries increase if level goes up (but they don't go down if level drops!)
00676             if( (ubStat == EXPERAMT) && fChangeTypeIncrease)
00677             {
00678                   // if the guy is employed by player
00679                   if (pSoldier != NULL)
00680                   {
00681                         switch (pSoldier->ubWhatKindOfMercAmI)
00682                         {
00683                               case MERC_TYPE__AIM_MERC:
00684                                     // A.I.M.
00685                                     pSoldier->fContractPriceHasIncreased = TRUE;
00686                                     fChangeSalary = TRUE;
00687                                     break;
00688 
00689                               case MERC_TYPE__MERC:
00690                                     // M.E.R.C.
00691                                     ubMercMercIdValue = pSoldier->ubProfile;
00692 
00693                                     // Biff's profile id ( 40 ) is the base
00694                                     ubMercMercIdValue -= BIFF;
00695 
00696                                     // offset for the 2 profiles of Larry (we only have one email for Larry..but 2 profile entries
00697                                     if( ubMercMercIdValue >= ( LARRY_DRUNK - BIFF ) )
00698                                     {
00699                                           ubMercMercIdValue--;
00700                                     }
00701 
00702                                     //
00703                                     // Send special E-mail
00704                                     //
00705 
00706 //    DEF: 03/06/99 Now sets an event that will be processed later in the day
00707 //                                  ubEmailOffset = MERC_UP_LEVEL_BIFF + MERC_UP_LEVEL_LENGTH_BIFF * ( ubMercMercIdValue ); 
00708 //                                  AddEmail( ubEmailOffset, MERC_UP_LEVEL_LENGTH_BIFF, SPECK_FROM_MERC, GetWorldTotalMin() );
00709                                     AddStrategicEvent( EVENT_MERC_MERC_WENT_UP_LEVEL_EMAIL_DELAY, GetWorldTotalMin( ) + 60 + Random( 60 ), ubMercMercIdValue );
00710 
00711                                     fChangeSalary = TRUE;
00712                                     break;
00713 
00714                               default:
00715                                     // others don't increase salary
00716                                     fChangeSalary = FALSE;
00717                                     break;
00718                         }
00719                   }
00720                   else  // not employed by player
00721                   {
00722                         // only AIM and M.E.R.C.s update stats when not on player's team, and both of them DO change salary
00723                         fChangeSalary = TRUE;
00724                   }
00725 
00726                   if (fChangeSalary)
00727                   {
00728                         // increase all salaries and medical deposits, once for each level gained
00729                         for (uiLevelCnt = 0; uiLevelCnt < (UINT32) sPtsChanged; uiLevelCnt++)
00730                         {
00731                               pProfile->sSalary                                           = (INT16) CalcNewSalary(pProfile->sSalary,                                                fChangeTypeIncrease, MAX_DAILY_SALARY);
00732                               pProfile->uiWeeklySalary                        =                             CalcNewSalary(pProfile->uiWeeklySalary,                           fChangeTypeIncrease, MAX_LARGE_SALARY);
00733                               pProfile->uiBiWeeklySalary                =                             CalcNewSalary(pProfile->uiBiWeeklySalary,                   fChangeTypeIncrease, MAX_LARGE_SALARY);
00734                               pProfile->sTrueSalary                                 = (INT16) CalcNewSalary(pProfile->sTrueSalary,                                fChangeTypeIncrease, MAX_DAILY_SALARY);

00736 
00737                               //if (pSoldier != NULL)
00738                                     // DON'T increase the *effective* medical deposit, it's already been paid out
00739                                     // pSoldier->usMedicalDeposit = pProfile->sMedicalDepositAmount;
00740                         }
00741                   }
00742             }
00743       }
00744 
00745       return;
00746 }

00750 // pSoldier may be NULL!
00751 void ProcessUpdateStats( MERCPROFILESTRUCT *pProfile, SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier )
00752 {
00753       // this function will run through the soldier's profile and update their stats based on any accumulated gain pts.
00754       UINT8 ubStat = 0;
00755       INT16 *psStatGainPtr = NULL; 
00756       INT8 *pbStatPtr = NULL;
00757       INT8 *pbSoldierStatPtr = NULL;
00758       INT8 *pbStatDeltaPtr = NULL;
00759       INT8 bMinStatValue;
00760       INT8 bMaxStatValue;
00761       UINT16 usSubpointsPerPoint;
00762       INT16 sPtsChanged;
00763 
00764 
00765       // if hired, not back at AIM
00766       if ( pSoldier != NULL )
00767       {
00768             // ATE: if in the midst of an attack, if in the field, delay all stat changes until the check made after the 'attack'...
00769             if ( ( gTacticalStatus.ubAttackBusyCount > 0 ) && pSoldier->bInSector && ( gTacticalStatus.uiFlags & INCOMBAT ) )
00770                   return;
00771 
00772             // ignore non-player soldiers
00773             if (!PTR_OURTEAM)
00774                   return;
00775 
00776             // ignore anything without a profile
00777             if (pSoldier->ubProfile == NO_PROFILE)
00778                   return;
00779 
00780             // ignore vehicles and robots
00781             if( ( pSoldier->uiStatusFlags & SOLDIER_VEHICLE ) || ( pSoldier->uiStatusFlags & SOLDIER_ROBOT ) )
00782                   return;
00783 
00784             // delay increases while merc is dying
00785             if (pSoldier->bLife < OKLIFE)
00786                   return;
00787 
00788             // ignore POWs - shouldn't ever be getting this far
00789             if( pSoldier->bAssignment == ASSIGNMENT_POW )
00790             {
00791                   return;
00792             }
00793       }
00794       else
00795       {
00796             // dead guys don't do nuthin' !
00797             if ( pProfile->bMercStatus == MERC_IS_DEAD )
00798                   return;
00799 
00800             if ( pProfile->bLife < OKLIFE )
00801                   return;
00802       }
00803 
00804 
00805       // check every attribute, skill, and exp.level, too
00806       for( ubStat = FIRST_CHANGEABLE_STAT; ubStat <= LAST_CHANGEABLE_STAT; ubStat++ )
00807       {
00808             // set default min & max, subpoints/pt.
00809             bMinStatValue = 1;
00810             bMaxStatValue = MAX_STAT_VALUE;
00811             usSubpointsPerPoint = SubpointsPerPoint(ubStat, pProfile->bExpLevel);
00812 
00813             // build ptrs to appropriate profiletype stat fields
00814             switch( ubStat )
00815             {
00816                   case HEALTHAMT:
00817       psStatGainPtr = &(pProfile->sLifeGain);
00818                   pbStatPtr = &(pProfile->bLifeMax);
00819 
00820                   bMinStatValue = OKLIFE;
00821       break;
00822 
00823     case AGILAMT:
00824       psStatGainPtr = &(pProfile->sAgilityGain);
00825                   pbStatPtr = &(pProfile->bAgility);
00826       break;
00827 
00828     case DEXTAMT:
00829       psStatGainPtr = &(pProfile->sDexterityGain);
00830                   pbStatPtr = &(pProfile->bDexterity);
00831       break;
00832 
00833     case WISDOMAMT:
00834       psStatGainPtr = &(pProfile->sWisdomGain);
00835       pbStatPtr = &(pProfile->bWisdom);
00836                   break;
00837 
00838     case MEDICALAMT:
00839       psStatGainPtr = &(pProfile->sMedicalGain);
00840       pbStatPtr = &(pProfile->bMedical);
00841 
00842                   bMinStatValue = 0;
00843                   break;
00844 
00845     case EXPLODEAMT:
00846       psStatGainPtr = &(pProfile->sExplosivesGain);
00847       pbStatPtr = &(pProfile->bExplosive);
00848 
00849                   bMinStatValue = 0;
00850                   break;
00851 
00852     case MECHANAMT:
00853       psStatGainPtr = &(pProfile->sMechanicGain);
00854       pbStatPtr = &(pProfile->bMechanical);
00855 
00856                   bMinStatValue = 0;
00857                   break;
00858 
00859     case MARKAMT:
00860       psStatGainPtr = &(pProfile->sMarksmanshipGain);
00861       pbStatPtr = &(pProfile->bMarksmanship);
00862 
00863                   bMinStatValue = 0;
00864                   break;
00865 
00866     case EXPERAMT:
00867       psStatGainPtr = &(pProfile->sExpLevelGain);
00868       pbStatPtr = &(pProfile->bExpLevel);
00869 
00870                   bMaxStatValue = MAXEXPLEVEL;
00871                   break;
00872 
00873             case STRAMT:
00874       psStatGainPtr = &(pProfile->sStrengthGain);
00875       pbStatPtr = &(pProfile->bStrength);
00876                   break;
00877 
00878             case LDRAMT:
00879       psStatGainPtr = &(pProfile->sLeadershipGain);
00880       pbStatPtr = &(pProfile->bLeadership);
00881 
00882                   bMinStatValue = 0; // Snap: Since leadership can now be 0...
00883                   break;
00884             }
00885 
00886 
00887             // if this merc is currently on the player's team
00888             if (pSoldier != NULL)
00889             {
00890                   // build ptrs to appropriate soldiertype stat fields
00891                   switch( ubStat )
00892                   {
00893                         case HEALTHAMT:
00894                         pbSoldierStatPtr = &( pSoldier->bLifeMax );
00895                         break;
00896 
00897                   case AGILAMT:
00898                         pbSoldierStatPtr = &( pSoldier->bAgility );
00899                         break;
00900 
00901                   case DEXTAMT:
00902                         pbSoldierStatPtr = &( pSoldier->bDexterity );
00903                         break;
00904 
00905                   case WISDOMAMT:
00906                         pbSoldierStatPtr = &( pSoldier->bWisdom );
00907                         break;
00908 
00909                   case MEDICALAMT:
00910                         pbSoldierStatPtr = &( pSoldier->bMedical );
00911                         break;
00912 
00913                   case EXPLODEAMT:
00914                         pbSoldierStatPtr = &( pSoldier->bExplosive );
00915                         break;
00916 
00917                   case MECHANAMT:
00918                         pbSoldierStatPtr = &( pSoldier->bMechanical );
00919                         break;
00920 
00921                   case MARKAMT:
00922                         pbSoldierStatPtr = &( pSoldier->bMarksmanship );
00923                         break;
00924 
00925                   case EXPERAMT:
00926                         pbSoldierStatPtr = &(pSoldier->bExpLevel);
00927                         break;
00928 
00929                   case STRAMT:
00930                         pbSoldierStatPtr = &(pSoldier->bStrength);
00931                         break;
00932 
00933                   case LDRAMT:
00934                         pbSoldierStatPtr = &( pSoldier->bLeadership);
00935                         break;
00936                   }
00937             }
00938 
00939 
00940             // ptrs set up, now handle
00941 
00942             // Calc how many full points worth of stat changes we have accumulated in this stat (positive OR negative!)
00943             // NOTE: for simplicity, this hopes nobody will go up more than one level at once, which would change the subpoints/pt
00944             sPtsChanged = ( *psStatGainPtr ) / usSubpointsPerPoint;
00945 
00946             // gone too high or too low?..handle the fact
00947             if( (*pbStatPtr + sPtsChanged) > bMaxStatValue )
00948             {
00949                   // reduce change to reach max value and reset stat gain ptr
00950                   sPtsChanged = bMaxStatValue - *pbStatPtr;
00951                   *psStatGainPtr = 0;
00952             }
00953             else
00954             if( (*pbStatPtr + sPtsChanged) < bMinStatValue )
00955             {
00956                   // reduce change to reach min value and reset stat gain ptr
00957                   sPtsChanged = bMinStatValue - *pbStatPtr;
00958                   *psStatGainPtr = 0;
00959             }
00960 
00961 
00962             // if the stat needs to change
00963             if ( sPtsChanged != 0 )
00964             {
00965                   // Otherwise, use normal stat increase stuff...
00966                   ChangeStat( pProfile, pSoldier, ubStat, sPtsChanged );
00967             }
00968       }
00969 
00970       return;
00971 }

00990 UINT32 CalcNewSalary(UINT32 uiOldSalary, BOOLEAN fIncrease, UINT32 uiMaxLimit)
00991 {
00992   UINT32 uiNewSalary;
00993 
00994       // if he was working for free, it's still free!
00995       if (uiOldSalary == 0)
00996       {
00997             return(0);
00998       }
00999 
01000   if (fIncrease)
01001       {
01002     uiNewSalary = (UINT32) (uiOldSalary * SALARY_CHANGE_PER_LEVEL);
01003       }
01004   else
01005       {
01006     uiNewSalary = (UINT32) (uiOldSalary / SALARY_CHANGE_PER_LEVEL);
01007       }
01008 
01009   // round it off to a reasonable multiple
01010   uiNewSalary = RoundOffSalary(uiNewSalary);
01011 
01012       // let's set some reasonable limits here, lest it get silly one day
01013       if (uiNewSalary > uiMaxLimit)
01014             uiNewSalary = uiMaxLimit;
01015 
01016       if (uiNewSalary < 5)
01017             uiNewSalary = 5;
01018 
01019 
01020   return(uiNewSalary);
01021 }
01022 
01023 
01024 UINT32 RoundOffSalary(UINT32 uiSalary)
01025 {
01026       UINT32 uiMultiple;
01027 
01028 
01029       // determine what multiple value the salary should be rounded off to
01030       if      (uiSalary <=   250) uiMultiple =    5;
01031       else if (uiSalary <=   500) uiMultiple =   10;
01032       else if (uiSalary <=  1000) uiMultiple =   25;
01033       else if (uiSalary <=  2000) uiMultiple =   50;
01034       else if (uiSalary <=  5000) uiMultiple =  100;
01035       else if (uiSalary <= 10000) uiMultiple =  500;
01036       else if (uiSalary <= 25000) uiMultiple = 1000;
01037       else if (uiSalary <= 50000) uiMultiple = 2000;
01038       else                                                                    uiMultiple = 5000;
01039 
01040 
01041       // if the salary doesn't divide evenly by the multiple
01042       if (uiSalary % uiMultiple)
01043       {
01044             // then we have to make it so, as Picard would say <- We have to wonder how much Alex gets out
01045             // and while we're at it, we round up to next higher multiple if halfway
01046             uiSalary = ((uiSalary + (uiMultiple / 2)) / uiMultiple) * uiMultiple;
01047       }
01048 
01049       return(uiSalary);
01050 }
01051 
01052 
01053 UINT16 SubpointsPerPoint(UINT8 ubStat, INT8 bExpLevel)
01054 {
01055       UINT16 usSubpointsPerPoint;
01056 
01057       // figure out how many subpoints this type of stat needs to change
01058   switch (ubStat)
01059   {
01060     case HEALTHAMT:
01061     case AGILAMT:
01062     case DEXTAMT:
01063     case WISDOMAMT:
01064             case STRAMT:
01065                   // attributes
01066                   usSubpointsPerPoint = ATTRIBS_SUBPOINTS_TO_IMPROVE;
01067       break;
01068 
01069     case MEDICALAMT:
01070     case EXPLODEAMT:
01071     case MECHANAMT:
01072     case MARKAMT:
01073             case LDRAMT:
01074                   // skills
01075                   usSubpointsPerPoint = SKILLS_SUBPOINTS_TO_IMPROVE;
01076       break;
01077 
01078     case EXPERAMT:
01079                   usSubpointsPerPoint = LEVEL_SUBPOINTS_TO_IMPROVE * bExpLevel;
01080       break;
01081 
01082     default:
01083                   // BETA message
01084       ScreenMsg( FONT_ORANGE, MSG_BETAVERSION, L"SubpointsPerPoint: ERROR - Unknown ubStat %d", ubStat);
01085       return(100);
01086   }
01087 
01088       return(usSubpointsPerPoint);
01089 }

01092 // handles stat changes for mercs not currently working for the player
01093 void HandleUnhiredMercImprovement( MERCPROFILESTRUCT *pProfile )
01094 {
01095       UINT8 ubNumStats;
01096       UINT8 ubStat;
01097       UINT16 usNumChances;
01098 
01099       ubNumStats = LAST_CHANGEABLE_STAT - FIRST_CHANGEABLE_STAT + 1;
01100 
01101       // if he's working on another job
01102       if (pProfile->bMercStatus == MERC_WORKING_ELSEWHERE)
01103       {
01104             // Lesh: changed chance from 20 to 70
01105             // if he did't do anything interesting today
01106             if (Random(100) < 70)
01107             {
01108                   // no chance to change today
01109                   return;
01110             }
01111 
01112             // it's real on the job experience, counts towards experience
01113 
01114             // all stats (including experience itself) get an equal chance to improve
01115             // 80 wisdom gives 8 rolls per stat per day, 10 stats, avg success rate 40% = 32pts per day,
01116             // so about 10 working days to hit lvl 2.  This seems high, but mercs don't actually "work" that often, and it's twice
01117             // as long to hit level 3.  If we go lower, attribs & skills will barely move.
01118             // Lesh: changed wisdom divided by 7 insead of 10
01119             usNumChances = ( pProfile->bWisdom / 7 );
01120             for (ubStat = FIRST_CHANGEABLE_STAT; ubStat <= LAST_CHANGEABLE_STAT; ubStat++)
01121             {
01122                   ProfileStatChange( pProfile, ubStat, usNumChances, FALSE );
01123             }
01124       }
01125       else
01126       {
01127             // if the merc just takes it easy (high level or stupid mercs are more likely to)
01128             if (((INT8) Random(10) < pProfile->bExpLevel) || ((INT8) Random(100) > pProfile->bWisdom))
01129             {
01130                   // no chance to change today
01131                   return;
01132             }
01133 
01134             // it's just practise/training back home
01135             do
01136             {
01137                   // pick ONE stat at random to focus on (it may be beyond training cap, but so what, too hard to weed those out)
01138                   ubStat = (UINT8) (FIRST_CHANGEABLE_STAT + Random(ubNumStats));
01139                   // except experience - can't practise that!
01140             } while (ubStat == EXPERAMT);
01141 
01142             // try to improve that one stat
01143             ProfileStatChange( pProfile, ubStat, ( UINT16 ) ( pProfile->bWisdom / 2 ), FROM_TRAINING );
01144       }
01145 
01146       ProfileUpdateStats( pProfile );
01147 }

01150 // handles possible death of mercs not currently working for the player
01151 void HandleUnhiredMercDeaths( INT32 iProfileID )
01152 {
01153       UINT8 ubMaxDeaths;
01154       INT16 sChance;
01155       MERCPROFILESTRUCT *pProfile = &(gMercProfiles[ iProfileID ]);
01156 
01157 
01158       // if the player has never yet had the chance to hire this merc
01159       if ( !( pProfile->ubMiscFlags3 & PROFILE_MISC_FLAG3_PLAYER_HAD_CHANCE_TO_HIRE) )
01160       {
01161             // then we're not allowed to kill him (to avoid really pissing off player by killing his very favorite merc)
01162             return;
01163       }
01164 
01165       // how many in total can be killed like this depends on player's difficulty setting
01166       switch( gGameOptions.ubDifficultyLevel )
01167       {
01168             case DIF_LEVEL_EASY:
01169                   ubMaxDeaths = 1;
01170                   break;
01171             case DIF_LEVEL_MEDIUM:
01172                   ubMaxDeaths = 2;
01173                   break;
01174             case DIF_LEVEL_HARD:
01175                   ubMaxDeaths = 3;
01176                   break;
01177             case DIF_LEVEL_INSANE:
01178                   ubMaxDeaths = 3;
01179                   break;
01180             default:
01181                   Assert(FALSE);
01182                   ubMaxDeaths = 0;
01183                   break;
01184       }
01185 
01186       // if we've already hit the limit in this game, skip these checks
01187       if (gStrategicStatus.ubUnhiredMercDeaths >= ubMaxDeaths)
01188       {
01189             return;
01190       }
01191 
01192 
01193       // calculate this merc's (small) chance to get killed today (out of 1000)
01194       sChance = 10 - pProfile->bExpLevel;
01195 
01196       switch (pProfile->bPersonalityTrait)
01197       {
01198             case FORGETFUL:
01199             case NERVOUS:
01200             case PSYCHO:
01201                   // these guys are somewhat more likely to get killed (they have "problems")
01202                   sChance += 2;
01203                   break;
01204       }
01205 
01206       // stealthy guys are slightly less likely to get killed (they're careful)
01207       if (pProfile->bSkillTrait == STEALTHY)
01208       {
01209             sChance -= 1;
01210       }
01211       if (pProfile->bSkillTrait2 == STEALTHY)
01212       {
01213             sChance -= 1;
01214       }
01215 
01216 
01217       if ((INT16) PreRandom(1000) < sChance)
01218       {
01219             // this merc gets Killed In Action!!!
01220             pProfile->bMercStatus = MERC_IS_DEAD;
01221             pProfile->uiDayBecomesAvailable = 0;
01222 
01223             // keep count of how many there have been
01224             gStrategicStatus.ubUnhiredMercDeaths++;
01225 
01226             //send an email as long as the merc is from aim
01227             if( iProfileID < BIFF )
01228             {
01229                   //send an email to the player telling the player that a merc died
01230                   AddEmailWithSpecialData(MERC_DIED_ON_OTHER_ASSIGNMENT, MERC_DIED_ON_OTHER_ASSIGNMENT_LENGTH, AIM_SITE, GetWorldTotalMin(), 0, iProfileID );
01231             }
01232       }
01233 }

01241 
01242 // returns a number between 0-100, this is an estimate of how far a player has progressed through the game
01243 UINT8 CurrentPlayerProgressPercentage(void)
01244 {
01245       UINT32 uiCurrentIncome;
01246       UINT32 uiPossibleIncome;
01247       UINT8 ubCurrentProgress;
01248       UINT8 ubKillsPerPoint;
01249       UINT16 usKillsProgress;
01250       UINT16 usControlProgress;
01251 
01252 
01253       if( gfEditMode )
01254             return 0;
01255 
01256       // figure out the player's current mine income
01257       uiCurrentIncome = PredictIncomeFromPlayerMines();
01258 
01259       // figure out the player's potential mine income
01260       uiPossibleIncome = CalcMaxPlayerIncomeFromMines();
01261 
01262       // either of these indicates a critical failure of some sort
01263       Assert(uiPossibleIncome > 0);
01264       Assert(uiCurrentIncome <= uiPossibleIncome);
01265 
01266       // for a rough guess as to how well the player is doing,
01267       // we'll take the current mine income / potential mine income as a percentage
01268 
01269       //Kris:  Make sure you don't divide by zero!!!
01270       if( uiPossibleIncome > 0)
01271       {
01272             ubCurrentProgress = (UINT8) ((uiCurrentIncome * PROGRESS_PORTION_INCOME) / uiPossibleIncome);
01273       }
01274       else
01275       {
01276             ubCurrentProgress = 0;
01277       }
01278 
01279       // kills per point depends on difficulty, and should match the ratios of starting enemy populations (730/1050/1500)
01280       switch( gGameOptions.ubDifficultyLevel )
01281       {
01282             case DIF_LEVEL_EASY:
01283                   ubKillsPerPoint = 7;
01284                   break;
01285             case DIF_LEVEL_MEDIUM:
01286                   ubKillsPerPoint = 10;
01287                   break;
01288             case DIF_LEVEL_HARD:
01289                   ubKillsPerPoint = 15;
01290                   break;
01291             case DIF_LEVEL_INSANE:
01292                   ubKillsPerPoint = 60; // Madd - uncertain whether this number is right
01293                   break;
01294             default:
01295                   Assert(FALSE);
01296                   ubKillsPerPoint = 10;
01297                   break;
01298       }
01299 
01300       usKillsProgress = gStrategicStatus.usPlayerKills / ubKillsPerPoint;
01301       if (usKillsProgress > PROGRESS_PORTION_KILLS)
01302       {
01303             usKillsProgress = PROGRESS_PORTION_KILLS;
01304       }
01305 
01306       // add kills progress to income progress
01307       ubCurrentProgress += usKillsProgress;
01308 
01309 
01310       // 19 sectors in mining towns + 3 wilderness SAMs each count double.  Balime & Meduna are extra and not required
01311       usControlProgress = CalcImportantSectorControl();
01312       if (usControlProgress > PROGRESS_PORTION_CONTROL)
01313       {
01314             usControlProgress = PROGRESS_PORTION_CONTROL;
01315       }
01316 
01317       // add control progress
01318       ubCurrentProgress += usControlProgress;
01319 
01320       return(ubCurrentProgress);
01321 }

01333 // monitors the highest level of progress that player has achieved so far (checking hourly),
01334 // as opposed to his immediate situation (which may be worse if he's suffered a setback).
01335 void HourlyProgressUpdate(void)
01336 {
01337       UINT8 ubCurrentProgress;
01338

01340 
01341       // if this is new high, remember it as that
01342       if (ubCurrentProgress > gStrategicStatus.ubHighestProgress)
01343       {
01344             // CJC:  note when progress goes above certain values for the first time
01345 
01346             // at 35% start the Madlab quest
01347             if ( ubCurrentProgress >= gGameExternalOptions.ubGameProgressStartMadlabQuest && gStrategicStatus.ubHighestProgress < gGameExternalOptions.ubGameProgressStartMadlabQuest )
01348             {
01349                   HandleScientistAWOLMeanwhileScene();
01350             }

01354             {
01355                   SetFactTrue( FACT_MIKE_AVAILABLE_TO_ARMY );
01356             }
01357 
01358             // at 70% add Iggy to the world
01359             if ( ubCurrentProgress >= gGameExternalOptions.ubGameProgressIggyAvaliable && gStrategicStatus.ubHighestProgress < gGameExternalOptions.ubGameProgressIggyAvaliable )
01360             {
01361                   gMercProfiles[ IGGY ].sSectorX = 5;
01362                   gMercProfiles[ IGGY ].sSectorY = MAP_ROW_C;
01363             }
01364 
01365             gStrategicStatus.ubHighestProgress = ubCurrentProgress;
01366 
01367             // debug message
01368             ScreenMsg( MSG_FONT_RED, MSG_DEBUG, L"New player progress record: %d%%", gStrategicStatus.ubHighestProgress );
01369       }

01492       for ( ubGuynum = gTacticalStatus.Team[ gbPlayerNum ].bFirstID, pSoldier = MercPtrs[ ubGuynum ];
01493                         ubGuynum <= gTacticalStatus.Team[ gbPlayerNum ].bLastID;

01506 void BuildStatChangeString( STR16 wString, STR16 wName, BOOLEAN fIncrease, INT16 sPtsChanged, UINT8 ubStat )
01507 {
01508       UINT8 ubStringIndex;
01509 
01510 
01511       Assert( sPtsChanged != 0 );
01512       Assert( ubStat >= FIRST_CHANGEABLE_STAT );
01513       Assert( ubStat <= LAST_CHANGEABLE_STAT );
01514 
01515       // if just a 1 point change
01516       if ( abs( sPtsChanged ) == 1 )
01517       {
01518             // use singular
01519             ubStringIndex = 2;
01520       }
01521       else
01522       {
01523             ubStringIndex = 3;
01524             // use plural
01525       }
01526 
01527       if ( ubStat == EXPERAMT )
01528       {
01529             // use "level/levels instead of point/points
01530             ubStringIndex += 2;
01531       }
01532 
01533       swprintf( wString, L"%s %s %d %s %s", wName, sPreStatBuildString[ fIncrease ? 1 : 0 ], abs( sPtsChanged ), 
01534                               sPreStatBuildString[ ubStringIndex ], sStatGainStrings[ ubStat - FIRST_CHANGEABLE_STAT ] );
01535 }

01539 UINT8 CalcImportantSectorControl( void )
01540 {
01541       UINT8 ubMapX, ubMapY;
01542       UINT8 ubSectorControlPts = 0;
01543 
01544 
01545       for ( ubMapX = 1; ubMapX < MAP_WORLD_X - 1; ubMapX++ )
01546       {
01547             for ( ubMapY = 1; ubMapY < MAP_WORLD_Y - 1; ubMapY++ )
01548             {
01549                   // if player controlled
01550                   if ( StrategicMap[ CALCULATE_STRATEGIC_INDEX( ubMapX, ubMapY ) ].fEnemyControlled == FALSE )
01551                   {
01552                         // towns where militia can be trained and SAM sites are important sectors
01553                         if ( MilitiaTrainingAllowedInSector( ubMapX, ubMapY, 0 ) )
01554                         {
01555                               ubSectorControlPts++;
01556 
01557                               // SAM sites count double - they have no income, but have significant air control value
01558                               if ( IsThisSectorASAMSector( ubMapX, ubMapY, 0 ) )
01559                               {
01560                                     ubSectorControlPts++;
01561                               }
01562                         }
01563                   }
01564             }
01565       }
01566 
01567       return( ubSectorControlPts );
01568 }
